page.title: 12Health.
page.content: The general health standards of the people of Riding Mill are very good. There are no particular problems with the children of the village, but there are problems with the elderly probably due to loneliness. There is no longer a surgery in the village but there is a clinic held in the Parish Hall. Babies are weighed and given their injections and if there are any problems there is a doctor and the Health Visitor talks to mothers about feeding and changing. There is also a chiropody clinic and meals on wheels for the elderly. Medicines are taken to a cottage in Broomhaugh and the people go there to collect their medicines and pills instead of travelling to Corbridge. There is a volunteer rota for this good cause. The doctor nurse and dentist visit the children at school.
